intro: Gaultheria leucocarpa, commonly known as the white-flowered wintergreen, is a shrub native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many acid-loving plants such as blueberries and heathers. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are dark green and glossy on top and white underneath. Its flowers are white, bell-shaped, and appear in clusters, blooming in late winter to early spring. The plant produces small, red, fleshy fruits that are edible and contain seeds.
